titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Harriet G. Davis Diaries 1912-1935

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by Ute Schechter, 2009

frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Harriet G. Davis Diaries, 1912-1935 A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2009.188
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2012 &contact;
Processed By
Special Collections Staff.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Two five-year diaries, 1912-1916 and 1931-1935, kept by Harriet G. Davis of Hanover and Nashua, New Hampshire. Recorded are comments about her work as nurse, daily household chores, weather, health, outings and social events. At the end of the 1912-1916 volume, Davis lists wedding presents received.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harriet G. Davis Diaries, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 05/01/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and processed by Ute Schechter in May 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harriet G. Davis lived in N.H. during the time period the diaries were written, 1912-1916 and 1931-1935. Her name while beginning the first diary was Harriet E. Gilbert. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Harriet G. Davis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two five-year diaries, 1912-1916 and 1931-1935, kept by Harriet G. Davis of Hanover and Nashua, New Hampshire. Recorded are comments about her work as nurse, daily household chores, weather, health, outings and social events. At the end of the 1912-1916 volume, Davis lists wedding presents received.
